title: Program Structure
content: In C, every program starts with a `main()` function. This is the entry point where the execution begins.

quiz.question: What is the entry point of a C program?

title: Variables
content: Variables in C are used to store data, which can be changed during program execution.

quiz.question: Which keyword is used to declare an integer variable?

title: Data Types
content: Data types in C define the type of data that can be stored in a variable. Common data types include int, char, float, and double.

quiz.question: Which data type is used to store decimal values?

title: Constants
content: Constants are fixed values that do not change during the execution of a program. They are declared using the `const` keyword.

quiz.question: Which keyword is used to declare a constant?

title: Operators
content: Operators in C are used to perform operations on variables and values. Examples include arithmetic (+, -, *, /) and logical (&&, ||, !) operators.

title: Control Statements
content: Control statements like if, else, and switch are used to make decisions in a program.

quiz.question: Which statement is used for multiple conditional branches?

title: Loops
content: Loops are used to execute a block of code repeatedly. Common loops in C include for, while, and do-while.

quiz.question: Which loop checks the condition after executing the block?

title: Functions
content: Functions are blocks of code designed to perform specific tasks. They improve code reusability and readability.

quiz.question: Which keyword is used to define a function in C?

title: Arrays
content: Arrays are collections of data items of the same type, stored in contiguous memory locations. They are declared using square brackets [].

quiz.question: How do you access the first element of an array named `arr`?

title: Pointers
content: Pointers are variables that store the memory address of another variable. They are declared using the * operator.

quiz.question: Which operator is used to access the value at a pointer?

title: Structures
content: Structures in C are user-defined data types that allow grouping of variables of different types.

quiz.question: What keyword is used to define a structure in C?

title: File Handling
content: File handling in C allows reading from and writing to files. Functions like fopen, fclose, fprintf, and fscanf are commonly used.

quiz.question: Which function is used to open a file in C?
